Name: Carla Natasha Hunt
Description:
Carla was found dead in the foyer of her apartment. She died as a result of a single gunshot wound to the head.

> A 35-year-old [woman] was found shot to death Monday in the foyer of [her] Suitland apartment, Prince George's County police said.
>
> The slaying of [deadname] Hunt, who police said lived and dressed as a woman and was known as Carla Natasha Hunt, occurred at the Capital Crossing Apartments, 3930 Suitland Rd. Police found Hunt's body, with a single gunshot to the head, about 10:50 a.m. [She] was pronounced dead at the scene.
>
> Police released few details and said they have neither a suspect nor a motive. Anyone with information is asked to contact Crime Solvers at 301-735-1111 or 800-673-2777. All callers can remain anonymous.

https://www.washingtonpost.com/archive/local/2000/05/17/crime-38/7f4a59a7-fb48-4621-801d-4a8c643e6187/
Tweet:
Carla Natasha Hunt was shot in the foyer of her apartment in Suitland, Maryland (USA) on 15 May 2000.

She was 35. #SayHerName #TransLivesMatter #TDoR

Name: Astrid La Fontaine
Description:
Astrid was shot to death in front of witnesses.

The Guatemalan police was not interested in investigating her murder.

> On May 20, 2000, a man emerged from a car and shot to death Roberto Martínez Castillo (aka Astrid LaFontaine), a transvestite sex worker, while Castillo was standing on a corner in Zone 1 of Guatemala City

International Gay and Lesbian Human Rights Commission. “Transvestites Murdered While the State Stands By,” Action Alert, September 2000. URL /Amnesty International. Guatemala’s Lethal Legacy: Past Impunity and Renewed Human Rights Violations (London: AI Index: AMR 34/001/2002, 28 February 2002), 61.

http://www.thegully.com/essays/gaymundo/001023oasis.html
